items.title: Awesome R Learning Resources
items.content_text:
### Books / Uncategorized

*   [Introduction to Probability and Statistics Using R](http://www.atmos.albany.edu/facstaff/timm/ATM315spring14/R/IPSUR.pdf) - The book can be subdivided into three basic parts. The first part includes the introductions and elementary descriptive statistics; I want the students to be knee-deep in data right out of the gate. The second part is the study of probability, which begins at the basics of sets and the equally likely model, journeys past discrete/continuous random variables, and continues through to multivariate distributions. The chapter on sampling distributions paves the way to the third part, which isinferential statistics. This last part includes point and interval estimation, hypothesis testing, and finishes with introductions to selected topics in applied statistics. Author: G. Jay Kerns.
items.content_html:
Books / Uncategorized

  • Introduction to Probability and Statistics Using R - The book can be subdivided into three basic parts. The first part includes the introductions and elementary descriptive statistics; I want the students to be knee-deep in data right out of the gate. The second part is the study of probability, which begins at the basics of sets and the equally likely model, journeys past discrete/continuous random variables, and continues through to multivariate distributions. The chapter on sampling distributions paves the way to the third part, which isinferential statistics. This last part includes point and interval estimation, hypothesis testing, and finishes with introductions to selected topics in applied statistics. Author: G. Jay Kerns.

items.title: Awesome Coq
items.content_text:
### Projects / Frameworks

*   [Q\*cert (‚≠ê58)](https://github.com/querycert/qcert) - Platform for implementing and verifying query compilers.

### Projects / Libraries

*   [Bignums (‚≠ê24)](https://github.com/coq/bignums) - Library of arbitrarily large numbers.

### Projects / Package and Build Management

*   [Coq Nix Toolbox (‚≠ê41)](https://github.com/coq-community/coq-nix-toolbox) - Nix helper scripts to automate local builds and continuous integration for Coq.

### Projects / Tools

*   [coq-scripts (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/JasonGross/coq-scripts) - Scripts for dealing with Coq files, including tabulating proof times.

### Projects / Verified Software

*   [RISC-V Specification in Coq (‚≠ê115)](https://github.com/mit-plv/riscv-coq) - Definition of the RISC-V processor instruction set architecture and extensions.
*   [V√©lus](http://velus.inria.fr) - Verified compiler for a Lustre/Scade-like dataflow synchronous language.
items.content_html:

  • V√©lus - Verified compiler for a Lustre/Scade-like dataflow synchronous language.

items.title: Awesome Healthcare
items.content_text:
### Contents / Imaging

*   [DICOMcloud (‚≠ê229)](https://github.com/DICOMcloud/DICOMcloud) - A standalone DICOMweb server with RESTful implementation of the DICOMweb/WADO services.
*   [DICOM Server (‚≠ê484)](https://github.com/microsoft/dicom-server) - OSS Implementation of DICOMweb standard.
*   [Fiji](https://imagej.net/software/fiji/) - Open-source platform for biological-image analysis.

### Contents / Frameworks

*   [FHIR Proxy (‚≠ê73)](https://github.com/microsoft/fhir-proxy) - secure application that acts as an intermediary in the transfer of FHIR data to and from Azure API.
*   [FHIR Works on AWS (‚≠ê300)](https://github.com/awslabs/fhir-works-on-aws-deployment) - FHIR Works on AWS deployment.

### Contents / Integration

*   [FHIR Converter (‚≠ê461)](https://github.com/microsoft/FHIR-Converter) - an open source project that enables conversion of health data from legacy formats to FHIR.

### Contents / Data

*   [OpenSAFELY](https://www.opensafely.org) - Secure analytics platform for Electronic Health Records in the NHS.
items.content_html:
Contents / Imaging

  • DICOMcloud (‚≠ê229) - A standalone DICOMweb server with RESTful implementation of the DICOMweb/WADO services.
  • DICOM Server (‚≠ê484) - OSS Implementation of DICOMweb standard.
  • Fiji - Open-source platform for biological-image analysis.

Contents / Frameworks

  • FHIR Proxy (‚≠ê73) - secure application that acts as an intermediary in the transfer of FHIR data to and from Azure API.
  • FHIR Works on AWS (‚≠ê300) - FHIR Works on AWS deployment.

Contents / Integration

  • FHIR Converter (‚≠ê461) - an open source project that enables conversion of health data from legacy formats to FHIR.

Contents / Data

  • OpenSAFELY - Secure analytics platform for Electronic Health Records in the NHS.
